description: The underlying cause of the printing issues, referred to as the 'printing nightmare', stems from the presence of the SMB1 protocol in production networks. This protocol introduces substantial security weaknesses, making networks vulnerable to attacks. The recommended mitigation includes disabling SMB1 and implementing specific printing VLANs to secure network traffic. Furthermore, a failure to patch firmware and optimize spooler services can exacerbate these vulnerabilities. As organizations continue to use outdated protocols and ignore critical updates, they inadvertently create an environment ripe for exploitation. Proper patch management and adherence to best practices can significantly reduce the attack surface associated with these printing concerns.
